Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Caerin 4.2 (XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Australian green tree frogLitoria caerula; also L. caerulea/L. splendida hybrid

Literature Information.Literature: It might have an alpha helix conformation.Activity: Activity against B.cereus (MIC >100 ug/ml), E. coli (MIC 50 ug/ml), L.lactis (MIC >100 uM), L.innocua (MIC >100 ug/ml), M. luteus (MIC 6 ug/ml, S.aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC >100 ug/ml), S.epidermidis (MIC >100 ug/ml), S.uberis (MIC >100 ug/ml), E.clocae (MIC >100 ug/ml), P.multocida (MIC>100 ug/ml), and P. haemolytica (MIC <0.4 ug/ml).Discovery:  Found in multiple species.Updated 5/2020, 11/2015; 5/2020; 7/2021; 12/2024
Literature Information.Author: Stone DJM., Waugh RJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.1993, Australia
Literature Information.Title: Peptides from Australian frogs. The structures of the caerins from Litoria caerula.
